{"rule":"UPPERCASE_SENTENCE_START","sentence":"^\\Qfor details.\\E$"}
{"rule":"EN_A_VS_AN","sentence":"^\\QA binout is a binary file generated by LS-DYNA after running an \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\\Q model, and it contains various result databases, such as \"matsum\" (for material summary, like energy and rigid body velocities' data), \"nodout\" (for nodal data, like displacements and velocities), \"elout\" (for element data, like stresses, stress-resultants, and strains), and so on.\\E$"}
{"rule":"EN_A_VS_AN","sentence":"^\\QThe function \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\\Q takes the path to an \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\\Q \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\\Q file and returns a \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\\Q \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\\Q variable containing all the data in the \\E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\\Q file.\\E$"}

{"rule":"ID_CASING","sentence":"^\\QThe columns of the 2D arrays in the \"data\" structures in the \"elout\" database (say \"elout.shell\") correspond to elements IDs (stored in \"ids\") and their integration points (the number of which is stored in a field called \"nip\").\\E$"}
{"rule":"ID_CASING","sentence":"^\\QAmong the fields of the \"metadata\" structure is a field called \"ids\" that stores the IDs of the model entities, e.g. nodes, parts, etc.\\E$"}
{"rule":"ID_CASING","sentence":"^\\QThe columns of the 2D arrays in the \"data\" structure in the sub-fields of the \"elout\" (say \"elout.shell\") correspond to elements IDs (stored in \"ids\") and their integration points (the number of which is stored in a field called \"nip\").\\E$"}
